cheem 0.1.9000
  • Reference

Cheem tour; 1D manual tour on the selected attribution

Source: R/2_visualization.r
radial_cheem_tour.Rd

Create a linked plotlyof the global data- and attribution- spaces. Typically consumed directly by shiny app.

radial_cheem_tour(
  cheem_ls,
  basis,
  manip_var,
  primary_obs = NULL,
  comparison_obs = NULL,
  do_add_pcp_segments = TRUE,
  pcp_shape = c(142, 124),
  angle = 0.2,
  row_index = NULL,
  inc_var_nms = NULL
)

Arguments

cheem_ls

A return from cheem_ls(), a list of data frames.
basis

A 1D projection basis, typically a return of basis_attr_df().
manip_var

The , number of the manipulation variable.
primary_obs

The rownumber of the primary observation. Its local attribution becomes the 1d projection basis, and the point it highlighted as a dashed line.
comparison_obs

The rownumber of the comparison observation. Point is highlighted as a dotted line.
do_add_pcp_segments

Logical, whether or not to add parallel coordinate line segments to the basis display.
pcp_shape

The number of the shape character to add. Typically 142 or 124, '|' for plotly and gganimate respectively. Defaults to 142, '|' for plotly.
angle

The step size between interpolated frames, in radians.
row_index

Numeric index of selected observations. Defaults to TRUE; 1:n.
inc_var_nms

A vector of the names of the variables to include in the projection.

Value

ggplot/ggtour of the cheem tour, animation frames of a radial tour manipulating the contribution of a selected tour. Consumed by a spinifex::animate_* function.

See also

Other cheem consumers: global_view(), run_app()

Examples

library(cheem)
library(spinifex)

## Classification:
X    <- penguins[, 1:4]
clas <- penguins$species
Y    <- as.integer(clas)

rf_fit <- default_rf(X, Y)

#> default_rf: 0.2 sec elapsed
## Long runtime for full datasets:
shap_df <- attr_df_treeshap(rf_fit, X, noisy = FALSE)

#> Started attr_df_treeshap() at: 2021-11-26 13:45:29
#> attr_df_treeshap: 0.95 sec elapsed
this_ls <- cheem_ls(X, Y, class = clas,
                     model = rf_fit,
                     attr_df = shap_df)

#> cheem_ls: 0.16 sec elapsed

bas <- basis_attr_df(shap_df, rownum = 1)
ggt <- radial_cheem_tour(this_ls, basis = bas, manip_var = 1,
  primary_obs = 1, comparison_obs = 2)

#> phi_start > pi / 2; phi_start <- phi_start - pi & phi_max <- -phi_max
#> manual_tour: is_mv_x_neg == TRUE; phi_start <- pi / 2L - abs(phi_start); phi_path <- rev(phi_path)
if (FALSE) {
animate_gganimate(ggt, render = gganimate::av_renderer())

## Regression:
dat <- amesHousing2018_NorthAmes
X <- dat[, 1:9]
Y <- log(dat$SalePrice)
clas <- dat$SubclassMS

rf_fit <- default_rf(X, Y)
## Long runtime for full datasets:
shap_df <- attr_df_treeshap(rf_fit, X, noisy = FALSE)
this_ls <- cheem_ls(X, Y, class = clas,
                     model = rf_fit,
                     attr_df = shap_df)

bas <- basis_attr_df(shap_df, rownum = 1)
ggt <- radial_cheem_tour(this_ls, basis = bas, manip_var = 1)
animate_gganimate(ggt, render = gganimate::av_renderer())
}
